text: Legendary Lord
The Starblade, like its lance variant, is forged from the metal of a fallen star, the weapon's graceful lines belie the formidable power it grants its wielder.
This magical Armour of Fortune is an ancient family heirloom, and so beautifully crafted that the wearer's freedom of movement is completely unimpaired.
This finely crafted medallion has been passed down through the Stormriders for generations. Preserved with tempestuous magical knowledge, it was a gift from the Mages of Hoeth long ago.
Astride his griffon, Sharpclaw, Althran swoops down on his chosen foe and cuts them down with talon and beak.

Morvael's Sunset Citadel
Citadel of Dusk Landmark
The garrison-port was established long ago under the orders of the then Phoenix King Morvael. The looming towers still serve as a reminder of the Asur's colonial might.
The cheapest supplies, who cares if the food doesn't taste that good as long as it fills the soldier's stomachs? Well, the soldiers certainly do...

This magical Armour of Fortune is an ancient family heirloom, and so beautifully crafted that the wearer's freedom of movement is completely unimpaired.
Just like his ancestors, Althran looks beyond Ulthuan borders to ensure no foe sets foot upon her shores.
The world descends into Chaos and she will never be tamed! But Ulthuan does not have to share this mortal fate.

World Farer
Defender of Ulthuan
Ancestors of Renown

With an ancestry dating back to the first Phoenix Kings, Althran's ancestors have led Asuryan armies all around the world, earning great glory and renown. Althran is determined to carry on this grand tradition, and will stop at nothing to protect his people and the domains of Ulthuan.
Capable of reactions so fast, Althran makes even the quickest Swordmaster of Hoeth look clumsy in comparison.

Shore Riders
Sea Company
Fire Company
Wind Company
Bright Falcon Company
Sapphire Company
They have much experience charging from the beachhead and flanking enemy positions on the shoreline.
Marines of a thousand voyages, they have learnt much from the sea including its mortal poisons.
These Marines have found fire, works just as well against warriors as it does against enemy ships.
Only Shadow Warriors and the Sisters of Averlorn are considered their betters, though this is not always been proven to be true.
Only the greatest of Asuryan spearmen may join the company of the Bright Falcon.
Former Lothern Sea Guards, their skill was unsurpassed with a spear and handpicked to join this illustrious company.
Althran Stormrider
Althran Stormrider
Prince Althran is determined to uphold the ‘Stormrider’ name and will stop at nothing to protect his people and the domains of Ulthuan in glory and bloodshed.

Sharpclaw
Astride his griffon, Sharpclaw, Althran swoops down on his chosen foe and cuts them down with talon and beak.
Gains bonuses when Eatine and the Eastern Shores of Lustria are held by High Elves.
Receives penalties when Eatine and the Eastern Shores of Lustria are not held by High Elves.
Can recruit Nobles without the required building
All High Elf Legendary Lords leave temporary bonuses on regions they visit belonging to the Citadel of Dusk.
Improved diplomatic relations with Lothern and Order of Loremasters, for a little while at least.
Of Booty and Cargo

The Citadel of Dusk is a site of tremendous strategic importance as it allows the Asuryan navy to patrol, protect and ultimately control the western sea trade routes to Cathay and Nippon whilst suppressing the threat of Druchii corsairs & undead pirates to Ulthuan.
